name: The Sun at Night
description: Explore, blast, and shield your way through massive branching levels as Laika the space dog. This 2D adventure features customized gameplay and an incredibly deep narrative.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: AMD Turion II Dual-Core Mobiel M500 2.20 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: AMD M880G with ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4200 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8 Processor: 3.3 GHz FX-Series Six-Core FX-6100 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: nVIDIA GeForce GT 520 4GB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: The Sun at Night is a wonderful mixture of real history and fantasy. Nonetheless, a mere idea won't make a great game. But still, you should give a try.

The Sun at Night is worth playing for the story alone. The world and characters are nicely done. The alternative history setting is great. Other parts of the game are not so wonderful though. Art is all over the place: the propaganda posters and most of the environment art is great, while characters, monsters and character portraits leave much to be desired. As do animation, combat, platforming, enemy AI and bosses. But! Despite of the flaws I really enjoyed the game. Levels are enormous and for the most part are really fun to explore. Laika is adorable and character customization system is surprisingly good. I wish the devs would go full metroidvania with this though and tie exploration to various upgrades of Laika's suit. I shall definitely be looking forward for the sequel.
Fun metroidvania that could have been great with more base sequences, characterization, and polish.
